intro: Pycreus malabaricus f. stricticulmis, commonly known as the Malabar pycreus, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the tropical regions of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its striking, dark green leaves with a waxy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white and pink, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
